meaningMnemonic: A <radical>grain</radical>, from one <radical>evening</radical> to the next <radical>evening</radical>, experiences a <kanji>shift</kanji>. After two evenings, the grain has shifted from one location to another.
readingMnemonic: This <kanji>shift</kanji> is caused by the <reading>ea</reading>gle (い) that wants to eat the grains. Every other evening, the eagle swoops down, shifts the grains (eating a few) and then flies off.
